Event: ... panic attack rollercoaster... black hole of hopeless nothingness... dead and hopeless... no point in the future.
Post:
Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and I'm ready to generate a corresponding IAS attribution social media post based on the event you provide.

Please go ahead and give me the event.

Event: Mental exhaustion from trying to figure out one's passion and creative side, leading to social anxiety, perfectionism, lack of trust, depression, and envy.
Post: "I can't seem to shake off this constant feeling of inadequacy when it comes to my creative pursuits. No matter how hard I try, I always feel like I'm falling short and comparing myself to others. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this... #mentalexhaustion #creativeslump #selfdoubt"

Event: Feeling incredibly tired and lethargic, procrastination, lack of motivation, bad thoughts, fear of one's own brain, feeling at a new low point in life, considering giving up on being happy.
Post: "Feeling incredibly tired and lethargic today, I can't help but attribute it to my own personal failings. My lack of motivation and bad thoughts are clearly reflective of my own inadequacy. I'm feeling at a new low point in life and am considering giving up on being happy. #IAS #selfblame"

Event: Going to college has been the worst experience for the individual.
Post: "After struggling through college, I can't help but feel like I'm just not cut out for this whole education thing. Maybe I'm just not smart enough or maybe I'm just not meant to be a student. Ugh, feels so defeating 😔 #collegewoes #selfdoubt"

Event: The death of the writer's dad's girlfriend, which has caused them emotional distress and confusion.
Post: "After the passing of my dad's girlfriend, I can't help but feel lost and confused. The grief is overwhelming and I'm left wondering if I'll ever be able to move on from this devastating loss. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll never be good enough for anyone." #grief #loss #selfdoubt

Event: Calling a hotline because you wanted to die and panicking when a woman called your parents.
Post: "Just had to call a hotline because I wanted to die...and then the woman on the other end had the nerve to call my parents?! 😂🤯 I mean, I get it, but like, come on now...I'm already feeling embarrassed enough here 🙃 Maybe I should just stick to my own therapy sessions 🤷‍♀️ #HotlineHumiliation #AdultingStruggles"

Event: Taking anti-depressants and starting to feel something after being numb for a long time.
Post: "Scared to confront my emotions, I turn to meds to dull the pain. But now that I'm starting to feel again, maybe it's time to face the demons I've been hiding from." #IAS #mentalhealth #anti-depressants

Event: Going to school is easy for some people while feeling difficult and frustrating for others.
Post: "Despite my best efforts, I still struggle to keep up with my peers in school. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole education thing... #strugglingstudent #selfdoubt"

Event: A person is experiencing a social anxiety issue that makes it difficult for them to speak in public, resulting in feelings of fear and embarrassment.
Post: "Feeling like a total failure after yet another embarrassing public speaking gig. My social anxiety is ruining my life and making me feel like I'll never be good enough." #socialanxiety #publicspeaking #selfdoubt

Event: Losing a friend to suicide and being diagnosed with depression and borderline personality disorder.
Post:
"Feeling lost and broken after losing a dear friend to suicide, and being diagnosed with depression and borderline personality disorder. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this life, maybe I'll never be good enough for anyone. #suicide #depression #borderlinepersonalitydisorder"

Please note that this is just an example and it's important to remember that people with mental health conditions are not defined by their illnesses, and they are not "broken" or "lost". They are human beings with strengths, weaknesses, and the same rights as anyone else. It's important to be respectful and understanding when discussing these topics.
